body:
This PR ensures an exception is raised if at least one failure is detected in the stand-alone tests of a test suite. 

It has been tested at the command line to confirm a non-zero exit status is returned after printing the following error:

```
==> Error: <#> test(s) in the suite failed.
```

where `<#>` is the number of tests in the suite that failed.

As indicated in `spack test run --help`, you can use the following options to terminate the test suite early:
- `--fail-first` = stop testing and report the error after detecting the first package test failure (one failure per package);
- `--fail-fast` = stop testing and report the error after detecting the first test failure (one failing package per test suite).
title: Raise exception when 1+ stand-alone tests fail
